definition[0]: a regulatory authority has the official power to control an activity and to make sure that it is done in a satisfactory way
example[0]: New drugs have been approved by the regulatory authority.
definition[1]: having the purpose of controlling an activity, system, or industry, especially by rules
example[1]: The industry has set up a number of regulatory bodies.
example[2]: the regulatory authority for the marketing of life assurance and unit trusts
